parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
Abusive or scurrilous language, blasphemy. From blasphemos; vilification.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Forty. The decade of tessares; forty.
A (lunar) month. A primary word; a month.
